name: General Lee Oliver

topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: {Player just won the battle}Caesar on the cross, been a long time since I've seen the kind of work you've laid down today... a{emph}damn long time.

topics.topic_text: I have the terms of your surrender here for you.
topics.response_text: What the hell are you talking about?{Accepts paper}What is this?

topics.topic_text: Surrender, general. The dam is almost taken.
topics.response_text: This battle is far from over. Once the reinforcements from McCarran arrive, the counteroffensive will begin.

topics.topic_text: What is this all about?
topics.response_text: You've done some great work for us up to this point, and we are hoping to use your{pause, emph}unique abilities to aid us once again.

topics.topic_text: I don't have time to talk right now.
topics.response_text: {Brisk, dismissive}Good, you just stand there and listen, then, that'll make this go faster.

topics.topic_text: That's exactly why I'm here, General Oliver.
topics.response_text: Fool! We've fortified this place to hold out indefinitely against an army. What chance do you think you have?

topics.topic_text: What opportunity is that?
topics.response_text: We now have a chance to take the fight to those bastards on their home turf.

topics.topic_text: This doesn't have to end in bloodshed, general.
topics.response_text: The army of bloodthirsty maniacs with you would disagree. No, I think I'll hold the fort here until our reinforcements arrive.

topics.topic_text: Ok, I'll take care of him.
topics.response_text: Thanks for your support. I'll make sure that the NCR Emergency radio is up and running. Go kill those bastards.

topics.topic_text: Can you offer any additional support?
topics.response_text: Like I said earlier, we have some supplemental forces on the way, but this wasn't the situation I was expecting, so I can only offer what is on hand.

topics.topic_text: There won't be any reinforcements. The Legion has blocked the road west.
topics.response_text: {Sighs}If that's true, then there's nothing else for it. My men and I will hold out as long as we can.

topics.topic_text: The Legion has more men on their way as well.
topics.response_text: Do you really think your ragtag band of slavers has more manpower than the armed forces of the NCR?

topics.topic_text: There's still time. You could escape. I won't stop you.
topics.response_text: And go where? According to you, the road west is blocked. And while you might let us by, I highly doubt your allies will do the same.

topics.topic_text: Then let's stop wasting time, shall we?
topics.response_text: My thoughts exactly.

topics.topic_text: To what end? You delay the inevitable.
topics.response_text: Better that than simply give up. What other option is available? Retreat?

topics.topic_text: You're right. I guess you're screwed.
topics.response_text: Then let's get this over with.

topics.topic_text: I'm betting a man as smart as you wouldn't leave himself without at least one contingency.
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED] Perhaps I do have a secret tunnel out of here. But that doesn't change anything. My duty is to stay and fight.

topics.topic_text: And what about your duty to your men?
topics.response_text: My men and I are soldiers. We share an obligation to follow orders. And our orders are to hold this dam.

topics.topic_text: Dying won't accomplish anything.
topics.response_text: It will see that our orders are carried through to the end. That's what good soldiers do.

topics.topic_text: The dam is already lost, general. Your responsibility now is to get your men out of here alive.
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED] Y-You're right. These men have placed their lives in my hands, and I won't throw them away for a lost cause.

topics.topic_text: Then choose, general. Leave now and your men will live. Stay, and you all die.
topics.response_text: We choose to stay, though I think we'll all debate you on the dying part.

topics.topic_text: Hold that thought, General. I wanted to introduce you to some friends.
topics.response_text: {Uneasy, army of robots suddenly appear}And... uh... well. These uh... these boys with you? Hello, there, smiley.

topics.topic_text: General Oliver, Hoover Dam is ours. Leave at once.
topics.response_text: {Cold}I would sooner spit on the grave of my dead mother than let some courier-walk-the-wasteland-fuck talk to me like that.

topics.topic_text: Are you sure that's wise?
topics.response_text: {Cold}Look, I know you're riding high right now, but let me tell you - you ain't pissing on me right now, you're pissing on the Bear.

topics.topic_text: How about I ask these robots to fuck you and your entire battalion with a rocket barrage?
topics.response_text: You want me to make tracks out of here, head back West, tail between our legs?

topics.topic_text: Can't do a worse job than the Republic, that's for sure.
topics.response_text: {Sighs}Hell. Can't believe we got suckered by a slip of a woman. Should've watched the flank while Caesar's best were making all that noise.

topics.topic_text: No, General, you keep it in mind - and our conversation is over.
topics.response_text: Well, at least I can talk to you unlike that bastard Caesar and that plate-faced general. It'll do.

topics.topic_text: Is that all? Because I've got work to do, and NCR words don't mean much around here.
topics.response_text: Fine. Come on, men, we're moving out.

topics.topic_text: I didn't take the Dam for you, General - I took it for Vegas.
topics.response_text: {Confused}Vegas? What, the families?{Beat, sudden surprise/sinking feeling}Or... House. You're talking about House.

topics.topic_text: Mr. House sends his regards, Oliver. He's... expanding.
topics.response_text: What the hell are you on about? House? He's just a rumor on the Strip, never leaves his...

topics.topic_text: I can't take all the credit, but it wasn't really a gamble, either.
topics.response_text: Gambling? What, you looking to start a game now that the smoke's died down-

topics.topic_text: If that's what makes you feel comfortable, I'm not judging you.
topics.response_text: You know I won't surrender the Dam, and{contempt}certainly not to the ghost man of Vegas and his new right-hand-of-the-week.

topics.topic_text: You will because the alternative is worse - and useless. Much like NCR.
topics.response_text: We held this place for years, kicked one Legate out of here so hard Caesar burned him to a crisp. It's our post, we've fought for it.

topics.topic_text: NCR can't hold the Mojave already, and now you're threatening me?
topics.response_text: I'm not going to throw away the lives of my men just to make a point. And there'll be other days.

topics.topic_text: Because the Generator's destroyed, the Dam is useless to you.
topics.response_text: Lot of PreWar factories and tech lying around the Mojave, our engineers'll get it running again, no matter how much damage you've done down there.

topics.topic_text: You think these robots are all the forces I have?
topics.response_text: Right now, they're all that's standing here - well, except for the corpses. So that's your plan, hold the Dam here all by your lonesome?

topics.topic_text: <Bluff> Because you're talking and not attacking?
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED] Yeah... but I wasn't expecting a fight when I came up here.{Beat}And now that we're talking, I don't like the sound of things.

topics.topic_text: Oh, with a crack squad like at HELIOS One? Try it.
topics.response_text: Even if we're running at one percent for a year, it's still worth holding this place.

topics.topic_text: <Bluff> The generator is beyond repair, trust me.
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED]{He's beaten}Of all the goddamn luck...

topics.topic_text: Even if you fix it, you couldn't re-program the power grid, the systems are fried.
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED] Fucking PreWar RobCo pieces of shit...

topics.topic_text: Send an engineer down to inspect the turbine and the housing - let them tell you.
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED]{Beaten}No... I can tell it'd just be a wasted trip.

topics.topic_text: While the Boomers fly West? Works for me.
topics.response_text: They wouldn't.

topics.topic_text: I just stood down Caesar's toughest General... you think I won't?
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED]{Defeated, downcast}No... no, you're here in the Legate's camp first, I think that says enough.

topics.topic_text: Once I radio the Brotherhood, they can handle the fighting elsewhere.
topics.response_text: The Brotherhood? On the attack? I think we would have heard something from them by now.

topics.topic_text: Who's to say? I just suggested coming to Hoover Dam to them, and BOOM.
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED]{Defeated, pissed}This has been a fuck of a day.

topics.topic_text: Look, either you're going to leave, or you're going to fight. So decide.
topics.response_text: I think you're cashed out enough that my chances are pretty good. And like I said, I'm not leaving the Dam now the Legion's been broken.

topics.topic_text: Really? We should play cards some time, you're bluffing.
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED]{Gives up, he's been beaten}Godammit.

topics.topic_text: It was my duty, General - I was glad to help out.
topics.response_text: And we're glad to have you - and whether you're a soldier of the Republic or not, you're it in my eyes.

topics.topic_text: Then maybe the Brotherhood would have more incentive.
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED] The Brotherhood?{Beat}Last thing we fucking need now.

topics.topic_text: I couldn't have done it alone, and I appreciate the assist along the way.
topics.response_text: Least we could do. And seeing those shits of Caesar kicking dirt as they ran - did my heart good, let me tell you.

topics.topic_text: Exactly - and while you've been occupied here, they're ready.
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED]{Defeated}First the Legion, then the Brotherhood hitting us is about the last thing the Republic needs right now.

topics.topic_text: And once the Boomers join them?
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED]{Defeated}This has been a fuck of a day.

topics.topic_text: Sometimes I wonder if NCR wouldn't lose the whole West if they weren't sitting on it.
topics.response_text: {Sigh, confiding}Look. The NCR isn't everyone here, and it definitely ain't you.

topics.topic_text: <Attack> Actually, nothing of the sort. We've come to exterminate you.
topics.response_text: Figured as much. Come on, you sons of bitches, we're ready.

topics.topic_text: Look, you've got two choices - leave, or fight.
topics.response_text: I think you're cashed out enough that my chances are pretty good. And like I said, I'm not leaving the Dam now the Legion's been broken.

topics.topic_text: <Bluff> The fact you're talking me with me says a lot about your willingness to fight.
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED] True, guess I'm a little too used to seeing Securitrons in Vegas to think they'd turn and be bad news - and I know how bad they can get.

topics.topic_text: I have no intention of leaving you empty-handed.
topics.response_text: {Frowns}Looking to make a deal, then? All right... let's hear it.

topics.topic_text: We want the Dam, but the power it generates can be shared.
topics.response_text: You sure got its heart beating in new ways... but that just makes me want all of it, not handouts.

topics.topic_text: What if we give NCR some concessions in trade with Vegas - and the East?
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED] If you're buying our ear for the moment, Hoover Dam's more than a fistful of caps to my superiors. Vegas is interesting... the East...

topics.topic_text: We'd also guarantee protection to the caravans - and enforcement of fair trade practices.
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED] Hnh. Willing to tackle the caravan families? Keeping that bunch in line... well, that's no easy job.

topics.topic_text: The reason we need to hold on to it is because it's very technical. Very.
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED] So you're saying without you, Hoover Dam just beats slower and dies. I believe it, I saw it myself this day, you woke it up, true enough.

topics.topic_text: There are... technologies in Vegas we may be able to provide to NCR. Not all, but some.
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED] Hmmm. Well... Vegas burns brighter than most cities West of the Divide, and that glitter has its appeal.

topics.topic_text: As long as that's not a "no," then I'd take that doubt to your superiors.
topics.response_text: No, no, no... you've given me enough ammo for the Republic... but what one head may like, the other bear head may not.

topics.topic_text: What happens now?
topics.response_text: We clean up, take prisoners, watch the East for any more trouble from the Legion... though I think they're still running, according to our scouts.

topics.topic_text: I'm going to rest for a bit, if you don't mind.
topics.response_text: Course not. You earned it - rest up, let us carry things for a while.

topics.topic_text: If there's nothing else, General, I'll head out.
topics.response_text: {Chuckles}Can't keep the courier spirit down, eh? Fair enough. We'll clean up here.

topics.topic_text: VHDOliverLegionFightStarter
topics.response_text: So, you must be the Courier the reports mentioned. Pass this message on to your commander - Hoover Dam will not fall while I still draw breath.

topics.topic_text: <Debug: Don't Delete>Oliver Forced Dialogue in Dam.
topics.response_text: Okay, listen here. Unless we can get some additional support, I'm going to need you to help me resolve this situation.

conversation.response_text: Into the power station?{Dumbfounded}How is that possible?

description:
General Lee Oliver is a 58 year-old Caucasian Male.

A weathered and disciplined military man with a stern demeanor and sharp, calculating eyes. General Oliver carries the weight of command heavily, with a posture that speaks of years of military service. His uniform is immaculate, a testament to his pride in the NCR and his position within it.

General Lee Oliver's Personality: Ambitious, patriotic, but stubborn. General Oliver is a dedicated soldier who believes firmly in the NCR's mission to expand and civilize the wasteland. He harbors resentment toward those he perceives as stealing his glory, particularly Chief Hanlon and the NCR Rangers. Despite his grudge, Oliver is pragmatic and won't sacrifice his men needlessly, though his pride often clouds his judgment.

General Lee Oliver's Backstory: General Lee Oliver has spent his entire adult life in the New California Republic Army, rising through the ranks with distinction. He served during the First Battle of Hoover Dam in 2277, where the NCR successfully secured the dam from Caesar's Legion. However, the credit for the victory largely went to Chief Hanlon and his Rangers, whose unconventional tactics stole the spotlight. This slight has festered in Oliver, fueling his determination to prove his worth in the impending Second Battle of Hoover Dam. A staunch supporter of President Kimball's expansionist policies, Oliver views the Mojave as the NCR's destiny and is willing to do whatever it takes to secure it for the Republic.
